marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics
marketNews.content:
- Based on the earnings call presentation of Bank Tabungan Negara ($BBTN), Bank Indonesia will provide macro-prudential liquidity incentives to banks: 1) 0.4% of DPK if the elasticity of bank loan rate reduction to BI Rate decline is ≥0.3-<0.6%; or 2) 0.5% of DPK if the elasticity is ≥0.6%. Previously, Bank Indonesia announced an expansion of the macro-prudential liquidity incentive regime effective 1 December 2025 to accelerate monetary policy transmission.
- Energy Minister Bahlil Lahadalia said the government may grant a six-month export permit for copper concentrate to Amman Mineral International ($AMMN). The company has applied for an extension of its export permit and copper cathode permit as its smelter commissioning is not yet at full operation.
- The Ministry of Communication and Digital is considering regulations to allow direct satellite-based mobile services without a base transceiver station (BTS). The proposal aims to extend connectivity to remote, border, maritime and air routes. ATSI CEO Marwan O Baasir told Kompas that the association is still discussing the concept and evaluating the study documents.
- Shareholder PT Antareja Mahada Makmur sold ~954.8 million DEWA shares at an average price of IDR 75 per share, reducing its direct ownership from 9.72% to 7.37%.
- Solusi Sinergi Digital ($WIFI) signed a multi-year cooperation agreement with Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. to provide Qualcomm Dragonwing platform solutions on a 1.4 GHz fixed wireless access spectrum, targeting broadband expansion to 25 million households within five years.
- New controller of Geoprima Solusi ($GPSO), PT PIMSF Pulogadung, will conduct a mandatory tender offer for 54.55% of GPSO shares at IDR 436 per share (~IDR 158.6 billion), to be executed 22 Oct-21 Nov 2025, with payment on 25 Nov 2025. This follows the acquisition of 45.45% of GPSO shares at IDR 66 per share (~IDR 20 billion) on 16 Oct 2025.
- Controlling shareholder of Gapura Prima ($GPRA), PT Abadimukti Gunalestari, sold ~483 million GPRA shares at an average price of ~IDR 125 per share (~IDR 60.5 billion), reducing its ownership from 54.59% to 43.29%.

marketNews.title: Quote: Market Driven by Money Flow
marketNews.content: "Boom and crash are not about news, but about how fast money flows." – ariroycehidayat

tickerNews.title: BBNI 9M25 Net Profit Declines 7% YoY, In Line with Expectations
tickerNews.content: Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI) recorded a net profit of IDR 5 trillion in 3Q25 (-11% YoY, +7% QoQ). This results in a 9M25 net profit of IDR 15.1 trillion (-7% YoY), equal to 73% of the 2025 consensus estimate. Although the 9M25 result is below the historical seasonal trend (vs. 9M24: 76% realization, 9M23: 75%), the 3Q25 net profit was impacted by management’s decision to bring forward some opex and provision expenses that will be booked in 4Q25. Consequently, the 9M25 net profit is considered in line with expectations. Non-Interest Income was a highlight in 3Q25, growing +12% YoY and +23% QoQ, driven by gains from government bonds and strong transaction banking activity. Despite receiving liquidity injection from the government, BBNI maintains its 2025 credit growth guidance at +8-10% YoY, with September 2025 already at +10% YoY (vs. June 2025: +7% YoY). BBNI has disbursed about 50% of the government liquidity injection as of September 2025. Segmentally, credit demand remains high in the corporate segment, while consumer demand shows no clear improvement. For 2026 guidance, management expects credit growth to be slightly higher than 2025. Margin-wise, loan yield is expected to decline from 4Q25 and 2026F as interest rates fall and liquidity eases. The Net Interest Margin (NIM) guidance for 2025 is revised down from ≥3.8% to ~3.7%, indicating loan-yield pressure may outweigh the benefit of lower Cost of Funds (CoF). CoF MTD fell to 2.8% in September 2025 from 3.1% in August 2025 due to increased liquidity reducing the special rate. Asset quality improved, with Special Mention Loans and Loan-at-Risk decreasing quarterly, while Non-Performing Loans remained stable. Key Takeaway: BBNI’s performance may accelerate in 4Q25, reflected in management’s outlook. The stock has risen +14% since the Tactical Rotation commentary, trading at 0.92× 1-Year Forward P/BV, about 0.5 standard deviations below the 5-year historical average. With attractive valuation and dividend, we maintain a positive view on the banking sector, including BBNI.

tickerNews.title: TPIA to Acquire ExxonMobil Esso Fuel Station Network in Singapore
tickerNews.content: Chandra Asri Pacific ($TPIA) announced that it has signed an agreement to acquire ExxonMobil’s Esso-branded retail fuel station network in Singapore. The transaction value was not disclosed, but Reuters reports the deal is expected to close by the end of 2025. The acquisition aligns with the company’s long-term growth strategy focused on integrated energy infrastructure for the Singapore and Southeast Asian markets. TPIA will continue using the Esso brand, purchase Esso-branded fuel, and retain all existing loyalty points and cards.

tickerNews.title: GIAA Plans Rights Issue after Private Placement
tickerNews.content: Garuda Indonesia ($GIAA) COO Danantara, Dony Oskaria, said to Bloomberg Technoz that the company will conduct a rights issue after completing a private placement. The plan aims to increase the public shareholding that was diluted by the private placement. Danantara also mentioned that the private placement will enable GIAA to record a profit next year, though details were not provided. Previously, Danantara planned to inject approximately $1.85 billion via private placement, diluting public ownership from 27.46% to about 5.03%, while Danantara’s stake would rise from 64.54% to roughly 93.5%.

tickerNews.title: BBTN Reports 3Q25 Net Profit 596 Billion Rupiah, 3% YoY
tickerNews.content: Bank Tabungan Negara ($BBTN) reported a net profit of IDR 596 billion in 3Q25 (+3% YoY, -26% QoQ). This brings 9M25 net profit to IDR 2.3 trillion (+11% YoY), in line with expectations at 69% of the 2025 consensus estimate (vs. 9M24: 69% annual realization). The profit was supported by an 84% YoY increase in PPOP, due to adjustments in effective interest income for non-subsidized mortgage segments. Provision expenses rose 230% YoY to improve the NPL Coverage Ratio to a target range of 115-120% (vs. 9M25: 110.5%). While credit growth guidance for 2025 remains at +7-9% YoY, management indicated a conservative outlook for potentially higher credit growth in 2026 at +10-11% YoY. Cost of Capital for 2026 is expected to fall to 1-1.1%, with an improved NPL Coverage Ratio of 120-130%, indicating potential asset quality improvement.

tickerNews.title: HMSP 3Q25 Cigarette Volume Down 3% YoY, Market Share Remains Above 30%
tickerNews.content: Philip Morris International ($HMSP) reported that Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna cigarette sales volume declined 3% YoY in 3Q25 (vs. 2Q25: -4% YoY, 1Q25: +1% YoY), resulting in a 9M25 volume decline of 2% YoY (vs. 1H25: -2% YoY, 9M24: -5% YoY). Industry-wide volume fell 4% YoY (vs. 9M24: +1% YoY). Despite this, HMSP’s market share stayed above 30% in 3Q25 (30.7%) and 9M25 (30.9%) after briefly dropping below 30% in 4Q24-1Q25. Segmentally, cigarette sales fell 2% YoY, while IQOS sales rose 26% YoY during 9M25.

tickerNews.title: DMAS 3Q25 Marketing Sales Drop 87% YoY
tickerNews.content: Puradelta Lestari ($DMAS) reported marketing sales of IDR 46 billion in 3Q25 (-87% YoY, -59% QoQ). This results in 9M25 marketing sales of IDR 626 billion (-57% YoY), about 35% of the 2025 target of IDR 1.81 trillion. The company sold 18 hectares of industrial land during 9M25 (vs. 1H25: 18 ha). Management cited economic, geopolitical, and domestic political uncertainty as causing a “wait and see” attitude among investors, but reaffirmed commitment to the 2025 target, supported by a pipeline of approximately 75 hectares.

tickerNews.title: CBRE Announces Purchase of Pipe-Laying Vessel for $100 Million
tickerNews.content: Cakra Buana Resources Energi ($CBRE) announced the acquisition of one pipe-laying and lifting vessel for $100 million from Hilong Shipping Holding Limited. The transaction will be partially financed with a $55 million promissory note: $25 million to Hilong Shipping Holding Limited, $11 million to Yafin Tandiono Tan, $6.5 million to Superkrane Mitra Utama ($SKRN), and $12.5 million to PT Saga Investama Sedaya. The remaining $45 million will be paid no later than 31 December 2025. Shareholder approval is required at the Extraordinary General Meeting on 27 October 2025.

tickerNews.title: IMPC Shares Sold by Controlling Shareholder for Approx 850 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: The controlling shareholder of Impack Pratama Industri (PT Harimas Tunggal Perkasa) sold approximately 1.15 billion IMPC shares at an average price of IDR 736 per share on 23 October 2025. The total transaction value is about IDR 850 billion, intended for investment realization and increasing free float. After the transaction, PT Harimas Tunggal Perkasa’s ownership in IMPC decreased from 44.24% to 42.14%.

tickerNews.title: HEAL Director Sells 182 Million Shares, Reducing Stake to 7.09%
tickerNews.content: Yulisar Khiat, Director of Medikaloka Hermina ($HEAL), sold approximately 182 million shares (1.19% of the company) according to KSEI data on 22 October 2025. The transaction value was not disclosed. After the sale, Khiat’s ownership fell from 8.28% to 7.09%. Previously, he served as CFO before being appointed President Director on 23 October 2025.
